com.yantra.api.vas

Interface createWorkOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface createWorkOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      createWorkOrder creates a work order to perform one or more activities to do kitting, de-kitting, inventory change, compliance requirement or special services in a Shipnode.

    • Method Detail

      • createWorkOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document createWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                     com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        createWorkOrder creates a work order to perform one or more activities to do kitting, de-kitting, inventory change, compliance requirement or special services in a Shipnode. A work order can also be created for delivery service of a product item, or any provided service at a specified location. A delivery or provided service is represented as a service line on a work order. The product to be delivered is represented as a product delivery line.

        A kitting work order can also be created without components.

        For PS and DS work orders, PreCallStatus will be automatically defaulted based on pre-call rules. For more information on possible values, see the modifyWorkOrder javadocs.



        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
          com.yantra.vas.japi.ue.VASBeforeCreateWorkOrderUE
          com.yantra.vas.japi.ue.VASConfirmAssignmentsForWorkOrderAllocationUE
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalInventoryUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction CREATE_WORK_ORDER
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of createWorkOrder.
            Data published - VAS_CREATE_WORK_ORDER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ON_PLANNING_COMPLETE:
            This event is raised if the PlanningComplete attribute on the work Order is set to "Y", indicating that the planning is complete on this work order.
            Data published - VAS_CREATE_WORK_ORDER.ON_PLANNING_COMPLETE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised for each hold type applied on work order.
            Data published - VAS_ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published - YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes

        Template Support: Yes.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the elements except:

          WorkOrderComponent
          WorkOrderActivity
          WorkOrderActivityDtl
          Status
          PersonInfo

        Additional Information

        Work Order for Return and Exchange Order

          A single work order can be used for a return and exchange order. The Order element under WorkOrder element should have the exchange order information. The lines of return order corresponding to the exchange order can be identified by the OrderLineKey or by PrimeLineNo, SubLineNo and Order element under OrderLine element with return order information.
          In such orders the product amount displayed is the maximum of the total product amount of return order and exchange order.
          On cancellation of exchange order the work order will be switched to return order's work order i.e. the order information on the work order will be that of the return order instead of exchange order.

        Hold Type Processing

          A work order may be associated with one or more hold types upon work order creation. Hold types can be passed to the API, can be configured to be applied during work order creation conditionally, or both. The xml used to evaluate the condition to apply holds automatically is template based. The template is similar to api output template and can be extended the same way. For each hold type on a work order, a task queue request is created for the processing transaction of that hold type.
          XML for hold type condition evaluation - VAS_WORK_ORDER_HOLD_CONDITION.xml
          Template name: WORK_ORDER_HOLD_CONDITION.xml

        Additional Required Capacity Based On Region Level And Service Type.

          The additional required capacity for the work order will be computed based on the region that the ship to address falls under and the service type of the service items. Additional required capacity of each delivery service item will be treated as part of its fixed capacity. If there are more than one delivery service items in the work order, the maximum fixed capacity across the delivery service items in the work order will be used as the fixed required capacity of the work order.
        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details about the work order created. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
